ciphers.description: Single-substitution methods where each letter is replaced consistently throughout the message.

items.name: Additive Cipher
items.description: A cipher where each letter is shifted by a fixed value

items.name: Multiplicative Cipher
items.description: A cipher where each letter is multiplied by a fixed value

items.name: Affine Cipher
items.description: A combination of additive and multiplicative ciphers

ciphers.description: Advanced methods using multiple substitution alphabets for enhanced security.

items.name: Autokey Cipher
items.description: A cipher that uses the plaintext itself as part of the key

items.name: Playfair Cipher
items.description: A cipher that encrypts pairs of letters instead of single letters

items.name: Vigenère Cipher
items.description: A cipher that uses a keyword to determine the shift for each letter

items.name: Hill Cipher
items.description: A polygraphic substitution cipher based on linear algebra

ciphers.description: Methods that rearrange letters without replacing them, changing the order rather than the identity.

items.name: Rail Fence Cipher
items.description: A zigzag transposition cipher that writes text in a zigzag pattern

ciphers.description: Encryption systems using a pair of keys – public and private – for secure communication.

items.name: RSA Cryptosystem
items.description: RSA uses modular exponentiation for encryption and decryption. To attack it, Eve needs to calculate e^C mod n.
